text: packing peanuts they do more than just
protect fragile objects many are made
from a foam called polystyrene which is
similar to styrofoam found in other
packing materials packing peanuts are
shaped to interlock under pressure and
fill empty spaces they are extremely
lightweight containing 99.6% air but
they also take a long time to biodegrade
so instead of tossing your packing
peanuts in the trash consider some of
these other uses attach them to the back
of hanging objects to protect your walls
from chips and scratches if you're
having a hard time hiring a small nail
into the wall secure it with a packing
peanut cap sharp objects in your toolbox
or drawer to protect yourself from a
nasty chat line the bottom of a large
plant pot with packing peanuts they're
non-toxic and you'll use less potting
soil this will make the pot lighter and
easier to maneuver as well as improving
drainage if you're going out on a boat
attach a few to your keys
just in case they go overboard be
careful though biodegradable ones
dissolve in water or you can always
return your packing peanuts to a UPS or
other shipping store just call them for
us to make sure they take them and for
other drop-off points check the earth
911 website
you
